intro: Palicourea longistipulata subsp. longistipulata, commonly known as the long-stipule palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with prominent stipules. The flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have white or pale yellow petals. It produces small, two-lobed berries that are often consumed by various bird species. This plant is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
